thread.title: What is DVT, the condition that sidelined Victor Wembanyama?
thread.title_full: What is DVT, the condition that sidelined Victor Wembanyama?

author: fox32news
title: What is DVT, the condition that sidelined Victor Wembanyama?
text:
San Antonio star Victor Wembanyama’s season is likely over after he was diagnosed with a blood clot in his right shoulder.
San Antonio Spurs star Victor Wembanyama is expected to miss the rest of the NBA season after being diagnosed with a blood clot in his right shoulder.Wembanyama is beginning treatment immediately. The 7-foot-3 center from France was diagnosed with deep vein thrombosis this week after he returned from the All-Star Game.
Deep vein thrombosis, or DVT, occurs when a blood clot forms in one or more of the deep veins in the body, according to the Mayo Clinic. It is often found in leg veins but can also travel to other body parts."The clots can then travel through the bloodstream and get stuck in the lungs, blocking blood flow . When DVT and pulmonary embolism occur together, it's called venous thromboembolism ," the Mayo Clinic website says.
